content.name: p
children: Make sure to rename the .env.example file to .env and update it with your settings.

children.name: td
children: Use either development or production based on your current environment. The production env will ignore some debug information and run faster.

children.name: td
children: This is the api_key required in every request of the API

children.name: td
children: The port in which your application will be running. Default is 3000.

children.name: td
children: Defines the URL where the Webhooks will be sent. If empty no webhooks will be dispatched. See the Webhooks category for events reference.

content.name: p
children: After installing Node and extracting the whatsapi.zip file simply run the whatsapi-win.exe file.

content.name: p
children: Once you open, you will be prompted for a License Code. If you purchased WhatsAPI from CodeCanyon you will need to insert your Purchase Code. After validation the application will start.

content.name: p
children: Place whatsapi.zip downloaded from CodeCanyon in your desirable folder and run the following commands:

content.name: Fence
children:
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install -y unzip zip curl  gconf-service libgbm-dev libasound2 libatk1.0-0 libc6 libcairo2 libcups2 libdbus-1-3 libexpat1 libfontconfig1 libgcc1 libgconf-2-4 libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0 libglib2.0-0 libgtk-3-0 libnspr4 libpango-1.0-0 libpangocairo-1.0-0 libstdc++6 libx11-6 libx11-xcb1 libxcb1 libxcomposite1 libxcursor1 libxdamage1 libxext6 libxfixes3 libxi6 libxrandr2 libxrender1 libxss1 libxtst6 ca-certificates fonts-liberation libappindicator1 libnss3 lsb-release xdg-utils wget ffmpeg
unzip whatsapi.zip
./whatsapi-linux

content.name: p
children: Once you open, you will be prompted for a License Code. If you purchased WhatsAPI from CodeCanyon you will need to insert your Purchase Code. After validation the application will start.
